channel.title: Server All Ready, Portforwarding Stopping Me, Tried 1M Things!
channel.description:
Okay so 1 million things is a little OTT. But seriously I'm getting so annoyed at this.
First off, I don't have a client. I'm trying to connect using MoparScape. Should work no?
Right, now I'll cut to the chase.
When I run MoparScape and try to connect to my server through my no-ip link, it won't let me. BTW: Yes I'm running a listen server, not dedicated.
Any time I try this, I get the error message:
Error connecting to server. Must be down.Click "Cancel" and then "Start Server" to make your own.
This is nonsense. My server is up, it just can't connect :)
[size=12pt]Here are a few screen shots I have, some will be missing information, but that is because I do not intend to publicise my IP address, MAC address or any other information. :P[/size]
[IMG]http://img707.imageshack.us/img707/3620/19414718.png[/img] Here you can clearly see that my internal IP address is 192.168.1.65, most of you know what subnet I have now >.>
But you can also see my host name, "AIRO" and that the server is also running.
Moving on ...
[IMG]http://img696.imageshack.us/img696/5508/71851337.png[/img] In this screen shot, you can see my router's settings, not all of them :P
You can see that Relentless and RS are being forwarded to my host name. We only need to worry about the latter of the two, "RS".
[IMG]http://img340.imageshack.us/img340/1682/66359843.png[/img] Here is a screen shot of RS's settings. As you can see it forwards port 43594 to my host name. This is the port that my server is using.
[IMG]http://img440.imageshack.us/img440/6839/29030293.png[/img] This is a screen shot of MoparScape failing to connect to the server using my no-ip.
[IMG]http://img840.imageshack.us/img840/7049/38353374.png[/img] And finally this is my no ip. Without an IP address, because I don't need you seeing that :P Trust me, I know it's correct, I've tried pinging it and had a <1ms response. [hr]
With all that done, I can't see any errors. Can anyone help me?
Note: I can connect to the client using my internal IP address, loopback address (127.0.0.1) and localhost but not my external IP address or my no-ip.

item.title: Server All Ready, Portforwarding Stopping Me, Tried 1M Things!
item.dc:creator: @lilgdog13 lilgdog13
item.description:
@lilgdog13 wrote:

Im having the same exact problem! its making me so mad! I’ve been researching ways to fix this and i have tried every one! I have windows 7, 64 bit, mcafee security center with firewall, and a 2wire 909 at&t uverse router. Even when i type in 127.0.0.1 it says “you must be a member to login to this world…”

Read full topic
item.source: Server All Ready, Portforwarding Stopping Me, Tried 1M Things!

item.title: Server All Ready, Portforwarding Stopping Me, Tried 1M Things!
item.dc:creator: @Airo_HNTD Airo HNTD
item.description:
@Airo_HNTD wrote:

I have tried using a client. This was to no avail. I have had no success. I tried getting my friend to ping my no-ip. But even that failed. I’ve reset my router’s settings back to factory, and only got 1 custom port open. 43594.

I’ve done Windows Firewall as well, I just don’t want to go Static. There must be another way?

Read full topic
item.source: Server All Ready, Portforwarding Stopping Me, Tried 1M Things!

item.title: Server All Ready, Portforwarding Stopping Me, Tried 1M Things!
item.dc:creator: @Psycho_666 Psycho 666
item.description:
@Psycho_666 wrote:

Did you try using a client? If so what was the result?

Read full topic
item.source: Server All Ready, Portforwarding Stopping Me, Tried 1M Things!

item.title: Server All Ready, Portforwarding Stopping Me, Tried 1M Things!
item.dc:creator: @Airo_HNTD Airo HNTD
item.description:
@Airo_HNTD wrote:

.:BOOM:.:

Download a client and test it on a downloaded client ?

I was going to try this, but I’m not sure what client to use. I’ve just switched to Emulous 1.7 instead of Project16. I hadn’t made any changes so nothing has changed

Is there any specific client I should use?

paymon:

ok i had the same problem until like 2 mins. okfirstly go on canyouseeme and see what it says if it says server timed out or something similar u have as i did. ok so wat u have done is forgot to make a static ip address just go on portforward.com choose ur modem and then runescape private server and follow tutorials before u do this u must fix ur static ip address on here:http://portforward.com/networking/staticip.htm choose ur platform and follow instructions and by the way add me on msn im making server to wat source u got add me paymans2005@yahoo.co.uk

I have thought about this, the only problem is that I really do not want a static IP address. I am a listen server, and as such if the server was running I would also be doing other things.

Nonetheless, port forwarding as I have done should work fine. As I have no-ip’s client it will update if the server ever goes offline. Having a dynamic IP address will only change if my router loses it’s connection or my computer is switched off. Neither of these are likely once my server is running.

Read full topic
item.source: Server All Ready, Portforwarding Stopping Me, Tried 1M Things!

Okay so 1 million things is a little OTT. But seriously I’m getting so annoyed at this.

First off, I don’t have a client. I’m trying to connect using MoparScape. Should work no?
